body.p: Segments based on the structure of an enterprise’s internal organization have at least three other significant advantages. First, an ability to see an enterprise “through the eyes of management” enhances a user’s ability to predict actions or reactions of management that can significantly affect the enterprise’s prospects for future cash flows. Second, because information about those segments is generated for management’s use, the incremental cost of providing information for external reporting should be relatively low. Third, practice has demonstrated that the term industry is subjective. Segments based on an existing internal structure should be less subjective.
